life: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
Life is short, and it is up to you to make it sweet.
Life is a journey, not a destination.
The best way to predict the future is to create it.
success: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
motivation: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
love: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
Love doesn’t make the world go round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile.
The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
Love is not only something you feel, it is something you do.
happiness: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
The happiest people don’t have the best of everything, they make the best of everything.
Happiness is a choice, not a result.
The key to being happy is knowing you have the power to choose what to accept.
Happiness is not the absence of problems, it’s the courage to move through them.
inspiration: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
Dream big and dare to fail.
courage: Courage doesn’t always roar. Sometimes it’s the quiet voice saying, ‘I will try again tomorrow.’
You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you face fear.
The brave may not live forever, but the cautious do not live at all.
Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear—not absence of fear.
Take the risk or lose the chance.
wisdom: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.
The wise man does at once what the fool does at last.
friendship: A friend is one who knows you as you are and still invites you to grow.
Friendship is born when one person says to another, ‘What! You too?’
A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
True friends are never apart, maybe in distance but never in heart.
dreams: All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them.
The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
Dream as if you’ll live forever, live as if you’ll die today.
A dream doesn’t become reality through magic; it takes sweat and hard work.
Don’t let your dreams be dreams.
hope: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul.
When you’re at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hold on.
Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness.
Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
Once you choose hope, anything’s possible.
perseverance: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, but a lack of will.
Fall seven times, stand up eight.
The secret of success is to keep moving forward.
kindness: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
A little kindness goes a long way.
Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
Kindness is the sunshine in which virtue grows.
leadership: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
The function of leadership is to produce more leaders, not more followers.
Leadership is not about being in charge. It’s about taking care of those in your charge.
To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
Great leaders don’t create followers; they inspire others to become leaders.
gratitude: Gratitude turns what we have into enough.
Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance.
Gratitude is the healthiest of all human emotions.
Be thankful for what you have; you’ll end up having more.
Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
adventure: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.
The biggest adventure you can take is to live the life of your dreams.
To live is to explore, to explore is to live.
The real adventure begins when you step out of your comfort zone.
peace: When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace.
Peace is not absence of conflict, it is the ability to handle conflict by peaceful means.
Inner peace is the key to outer peace.
freedom: Freedom is nothing but a chance to be better.
The price of freedom is eternal vigilance.
True freedom is the ability to live without fear.
Liberty, when it begins to take root, is a plant of rapid growth.
trust: Trust is the glue of life. It’s the most essential ingredient in effective communication.
To be trusted is a greater compliment than being loved.
Trust takes years to build, seconds to break, and forever to repair.
Trust yourself, you know more than you think you do.
The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
change: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future.
You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
Change your thoughts and you change your world.
The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change their future by merely changing their attitude.
faith: Faith is taking the first step even when you don’t see the whole staircase.
To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible.
Faith is the bird that feels the light when the dawn is still dark.
Doubt is a pain too lonely to know that faith is his twin brother.
Faith sees the invisible, believes the unbelievable, and receives the impossible.
patience: Patience is not the ability to wait, but how you act while you’re waiting.
The key to everything is patience. You get the chicken by hatching the egg, not by smashing it.
Be patient. Good things take time.
Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy.
honesty: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
No legacy is so rich as honesty.
Honesty is the fastest way to prevent a mistake from turning into a failure.
Being honest may not get you a lot of friends, but it’ll always get you the right ones.
humility: Humility is the solid foundation of all virtues.
Pride makes us artificial and humility makes us real.
True humility is not thinking less of yourself; it is thinking of yourself less.
learning: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
The beautiful thing about learning is that no one can take it away from you.
A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
failure: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
Don’t fear failure. Fear being in the exact same place next year as you are today.
Failure is not the opposite of success, it’s part of success.
growth: Growth is painful. Change is painful. But nothing is as painful as staying stuck somewhere you don’t belong.
Without continual growth and progress, such words as improvement, achievement, and success have no meaning.
Growth begins when we start to accept our own weakness.
Be not afraid of growing slowly; be afraid only of standing still.
self-discipline: Discipline is choosing between what you want now and what you want most.
Without discipline, success is impossible, period.
Self-discipline is the magic power that makes you virtually unstoppable.
Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
resilience: Resilience is knowing that you are the only one that has the power and the responsibility to pick yourself up.
Life doesn’t get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.
The human capacity for burden is like bamboo—far more flexible than you’d ever believe at first glance.
Resilience is not about being unaffected by stress but knowing how to recover from it.
mindfulness: Mindfulness is a way of befriending ourselves and our experience.
Be where you are, not where you think you should be.
Mindfulness means being awake. It means knowing what you are doing.
The present moment is the only time over which we have dominion.
focus: Starve your distractions. Feed your focus.
The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
Focus on being productive instead of busy.
empathy: Empathy is seeing with the eyes of another, listening with the ears of another, and feeling with the heart of another.
Whenever you are about to find fault with someone, ask yourself the following question: What fault of mine most nearly resembles the one I am about to criticize?
Empathy is about finding echoes of another person in yourself.
Empathy is the starting point for creating a community and taking action. It’s the impetus for creating change.
discipline: Your level of success is determined by your level of discipline and perseverance.
Discipline is doing what needs to be done, even if you don’t want to do it.
Discipline is the difference between what you want now and what you want most.
balance: Happiness is not a matter of intensity but of balance and order and rhythm and harmony.
Balance is not something you find, it’s something you create.
A well-balanced person is one who finds both sides of an issue laughable.
Live a balanced life—learn some and think some and draw and paint and sing and dance and play and work every day some.
creativity: You can’t use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
The chief enemy of creativity is ‘good’ sense.
imagination: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
Imagination is the beginning of creation.
Everything you can imagine is real.
forgiveness: To err is human; to forgive, divine.
Forgiveness is not an occasional act, it is a constant attitude.
Forgiveness liberates the soul. It removes fear.
Holding onto anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
compassion: Compassion is the basis of morality.
If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
Compassion is the wish to see others free from suffering.
A kind gesture can reach a wound that only compassion can heal.
generosity: No one has ever become poor by giving.
Generosity is giving more than you can, and pride is taking less than you need.
The most truly generous persons are those who give silently without hope of praise or reward.
simplicity: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
Simplicity is the keynote of all true elegance.
The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
family: Family is not an important thing, it’s everything.
In time of test, family is best.
The love of a family is life’s greatest blessing.
Family is where life begins and love never ends.
Nothing is better than going home to family and eating good food and relaxing.
health: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth.
Take care of your body. It’s the only place you have to live.
To keep the body in good health is a duty… otherwise we shall not be able to keep our mind strong and clear.
A healthy outside starts from the inside.
time: Time is what we want most, but what we use worst.
Lost time is never found again.
Time flies over us, but leaves its shadow behind.
The key is in not spending time, but in investing it.
money: Too many people spend money they haven’t earned, to buy things they don’t want, to impress people they don’t like.
Money is a tool. Used properly it makes something beautiful; used wrong, it makes a mess.
Don’t let making a living prevent you from making a life.
It’s good to have money and the things that money can buy, but it’s good too to check up once in a while and make sure you haven’t lost the things money can’t buy.
work: Choose a job you love, and you’ll never have to work a day in your life.
Work hard in silence; let success make the noise.
The only way to achieve the impossible is to believe it is possible.
Work gives you meaning and purpose and life is empty without it.
education: Education is the most powerful weapon you can use to change the world.
The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
Education is not preparation for life; education is life itself.
self-love: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.
Talk to yourself like someone you love.
How you love yourself is how you teach others to love you.
Be proud of who you are, and not ashamed of how someone else sees you.
confidence: Believe in yourself and all that you are.
With confidence, you have won before you have started.
Don’t be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.
Confidence is not ‘they will like me.’ Confidence is ‘I’ll be fine if they don’t.’
mindset: Whether you think you can or you think you can’t, you’re right.
A negative mind will never give you a positive life.
Change your mindset, change your life.
goals: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
Dreams don’t work unless you do.
Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
choices: In the end, we only regret the chances we didn’t take.
Life is about choices. Some we regret, some we’re proud of.
Every choice you make makes you.
It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
habits: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
Good habits are worth being fanatical about.
The chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too heavy to be broken.
Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
hard work: There is no substitute for hard work.
Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day in and day out.
Hard work beats talent when talent doesn’t work hard.
Great things come from hard work and perseverance.
routine: A daily routine built on good habits is the key to success.
Your future is hidden in your daily routine.
Success doesn't come from what you do occasionally, it comes from what you do consistently.
A strong morning routine sets the tone for the rest of your day.
decision-making: Sometimes the hardest thing and the right thing are the same.
In every success story, you will find someone who made a courageous decision.
Don’t base your decisions on the advice of those who don’t have to deal with the results.
It’s not hard to make decisions when you know what your values are.
risk: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
Take risks: if you win, you will be happy; if you lose, you will be wise.
Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
pain: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.
Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls.
Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional.
healing: Healing takes time, and asking for help is a courageous step.
The wound is the place where the light enters you.
Healing doesn’t mean the damage never existed. It means the damage no longer controls you.
You have the power to heal your life, and you need to know that.
memories: Sometimes you will never know the value of a moment until it becomes a memory.
Memories are timeless treasures of the heart.
We do not remember days; we remember moments.
The best things in life are the people we love, the places we’ve been, and the memories we’ve made along the way.
identity: Don’t let anyone define who you are. Define yourself.
To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
Know who you are and be that.
Your identity is not in what you do, but in who you are.
purpose: The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
Your purpose in life is to find your purpose and give your whole heart and soul to it.
Efforts and courage are not enough without purpose and direction.
When you live with purpose, you feel alive.
rest: Rest is not idleness. It’s restoration.
Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes… including you.
Rest when you’re weary. Refresh and renew yourself.
Taking time to do nothing often brings everything into perspective.
emotions: Feelings are much like waves. We can’t stop them from coming, but we can choose which one to surf.
Emotions are not problems to be solved. They are signals to be interpreted.
Don’t let your emotions overpower your intelligence.
It’s okay to feel. Just don’t let the feelings control you.
presence: Wherever you are, be all there.
The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.
Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
This moment is all there is.
reputation: It takes 20 years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it.
Your reputation is what others think of you; your character is what you truly are.
Live in such a way that if someone spoke badly of you, no one would believe it.
Your reputation is in the hands of others. That's what the reputation is. You can't control that.
truth: The truth will set you free, but first it will piss you off.
Three things cannot be long hidden: the sun, the moon, and the truth.
Telling the truth and making someone cry is better than telling a lie and making someone smile.
Honesty is telling the truth to ourselves and others. Integrity is living that truth.
vision: Create the highest grandest vision possible for your life, because you become what you believe.
Vision without action is a dream. Action without vision is simply passing the time.
A strong vision draws in the right people and ideas.
You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.
Hold the vision, trust the process.
boundaries: Daring to set boundaries is about having the courage to love ourselves even when we risk disappointing others.
You teach people how to treat you by what you allow.
Boundaries are a part of self-care. They are healthy, normal, and necessary.
Sometimes the most loving thing you can do is say ‘no.’
legacy: Carve your name on hearts, not tombstones.
Your legacy is every life you’ve touched.
We all die. The goal isn’t to live forever, the goal is to create something that will.
Leave the world better than you found it.
integrity: Integrity is doing the right thing, even when no one is watching.
In matters of style, swim with the current; in matters of principle, stand like a rock.
Live so that when your children think of fairness, caring, and integrity, they think of you.
vulnerability: Vulnerability is the birthplace of innovation, creativity, and change.
What makes you vulnerable makes you beautiful.
Being vulnerable is not a sign of weakness, it’s a sign of courage.
Sometimes you have to break to grow.
energy: Protect your energy. It’s your most valuable currency.
Your energy introduces you before you even speak.
Where your attention goes, your energy flows.
Don’t chase energy. Attract it by being it.
self-awareness: Self-awareness is the first step to self-improvement.
Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
The unexamined life is not worth living.
Self-awareness allows you to see your strengths and weaknesses clearly.
self-acceptance: Self-acceptance is the foundation of self-love.
You are enough just as you are.
Embrace who you are, flaws and all.
The most powerful relationship you will ever have is the relationship with yourself.
self-improvement: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.
You can’t improve what you don’t measure.
Small daily improvements over time lead to stunning results.
self-care: Self-care is not a luxury, it’s a necessity.
You can’t pour from an empty cup. Take care of yourself first.
Self-care is how you take your power back.
Taking care of yourself doesn’t mean me first, it means me too.
self-discovery: The journey of self-discovery is the most important journey you will ever take.
Self-discovery is the process of finding out who you are and what you want.
You can’t discover new oceans unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change their future by merely changing their attitude.
self-confidence: Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings.
Confidence comes not from always being right but from not fearing to be wrong.
Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.
Self-confidence is the memory of success.
self-esteem: Self-esteem is as important to our well-being as legs are to a table.
Low self-esteem is like driving through life with your hand-break on.
You are worthy of love and respect just as you are.
Your self-worth is determined by you. You don’t have to depend on someone telling you who you are.
self-expression: Self-expression is the most powerful form of self-discovery.
Your self-expression is your unique voice in the world.
The more you express yourself, the more you become who you are.
Self-expression is about being true to yourself and sharing that with the world.
self-reflection: Self-reflection is the school of wisdom.
The unexamined life is not worth living.
Self-reflection is the key to personal growth.
Take time to reflect on your life and your choices.
